reg_info.act_under: Health Care Consent Act, 1996   Loi de 1996 sur le consentement aux soins de santé

content.content: 1. (1) Social workers are evaluators for the purposes of subsection 2 (1) of the Act.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1. (2) In this section, “social worker” means a member of the Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers who holds a certificate of registration for social work.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) Social workers are evaluators for the purposes of subsection 2 (1) of the Act.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1.

(2) In this section,

“social worker” means a member of the Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers who holds a certificate of registration for social work.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1.

content.content: 2. Social workers and persons described in clauses (a) to (g) of the definition of “evaluator” in subsection 2 (1) of the Act may act as evaluators in the following circumstances: 1. For the purpose of determining whether a person is capable with respect to his or her admission to a care facility. 2. For the purpose of determining whether a person is capable with respect to a personal assistance service.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
2. Social workers and persons described in clauses (a) to (g) of the definition of “evaluator” in subsection 2 (1) of the Act may act as evaluators in the following circumstances:

1. For the purpose of determining whether a person is capable with respect to his or her admission to a care facility.

2. For the purpose of determining whether a person is capable with respect to a personal assistance service.  O. Reg. 517/10, s. 1.
